item.title: Machine Learning Regression Implementation with SciKit Learn
item.description: ScitKitLearn Simple Linear Regression Implementation with Sample Dataset I load in the necessary libraries. import pandas as pd from sklearn import model_selection, linear_model I read my dataset in with pandas and define my features. df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv') features = ['col0','col1','col2','col3','col4','col5','col6','col7','col8','col9','col10'] I define my model and set an X and y variable to set up cross-validation. model = linear_model.LinearRegression() X = df[features] y = df.label xval = model_selection.KFold(10, shuffle=True) results = model_selection.

item.title: Regular Show IMDB Web Scrape and Data Analysis
item.description: Today I will be scraping Regular Show’s IMDB page. I will compare the ratings of every other season for a total of 4 seasons. Season 1 Ratings Scrape: s1_page <- read_html("https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1710308/episodes?season=1") s1_title <- s1_page %>% html_nodes("#episodes_content strong a") %>% html_text() s1_stars <- s1_page %>% html_nodes(".ipl-rating-star.small .ipl-rating-star__rating") %>% html_text() %>% as.numeric() Season 3 Ratings Scrape: s3_page <- read_html("https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1710308/episodes?season=3") s3_title <- s3_page %>% html_nodes("#episodes_content strong a") %>% html_text() s3_stars <- s3_page %>% html_nodes(".
